questions.question: An atom consists of three parts, proton, neutron and
What is the mass of an electron

Electrons moving with a constant velocity enter a uniform magnetic field B in a direction perpendicular to B. the electron path in the field is
questions.opt2: a straight line parallel to B
questions.opt3: a straight line perpendicular to B

questions.question: Heat is supplied to a test-tube containing 100g of ice at its melting point. The ice melts completely in 1 minute. What is the power rating of the source of heat (Latent heat of fusion of ice = 336Jg<sup>-1</sup>)
If a room is saturated with water vapour, the temperature of the room must be
questions.opt4: below or at the dew point
questions.ans: below or at the dew point

questions.question: What happens when a gas expands at constant temperature?
questions.opt2: The total momentum of its molecules remains constant
questions.opt3: Its pressure decreases and the total momentum of its molecules remain constant
questions.opt4: Its pressure decreases and the total kinetic energy of its molecules decreases
questions.ans: Its pressure decreases and the total kinetic energy of its molecules decreases

A small metal ball is thrown vertically upwards from the top of a tower with an initial velocity of 20ms<sup>-1</sup>. If the ball took a total of 6s to reach ground level, determine the height of the tower (g = 10ms<sup>-2</sup>)

A body of mass 100g moving with a velocity of 10.0ms<sup>-1</sup> collides with a wall. If after the collision, it moves with a velocity of 2.0ms<sup>-1</sup> in the opposite direction, calculate the change in momentum

Three electric cells each of e.m.f 1.5V and internal resistance 1.0ohms are connected in parallel across an external resistance 2/3ohms. Calculate the value of the current in the resistor
In a metre bridge experiment, two resistors 2 ohms and 3 ohms occupy the left and right gaps respectively. Find the balance point from the left side of the bridge
Which of the following can be used to reduce local action in a leclanche cell?
questions.opt1: carbon rod as the positive pole
questions.opt2: pure zinc as the negative pole
questions.opt3: potassium permanganate solution in contact with the positive pole
questions.ans: pure zinc as the negative pole

questions.question: An ebonite rod rubbed with fur attracts a glass rod rubbed with silk because
questions.opt1: ebonite has a negative charge while glass has a positive charge
questions.opt2: ebonite has positive charge while glass has negative charge
questions.ans: ebonite has a negative charge while glass has a positive charge
